summary: Antibiotic- and antifungal-resistant infections pose a serious public health issue. Yet there may not be a sufficient number of drugs in development to meet this threat. The Food and Drug Administration can use its "limited population pathway process" to approve antibacterial and antifungal drugs for rare, serious or life-threatening infections.
